handDesc.p: Halantas. Final T in l2, l33 twice. Final M in l41.

Original punctuation. The spiral opening symbol and the word svasti are to the left of lines 1 and 2 respectively. The closing spiral is rotated 180° with respect to the opening one, so that the opening spiral has its tail ending at the left pointing up, while the closing one’s tail ends on the right, pointing down. CHECK if there is also a horizontal mark after the closing double daṇḍa.
Other palaeographic observations. Anusvāra is at head height or lower after the character to which it belongs.

projectDesc.p: This project DHARMA has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement no 809994).

prefixDef.p: Public URIs with the prefix bib to point to a Zotero Group Library named ERC-DHARMA whose data are open to the public.
Internal URIs using the part prefix to point to person elements in the DHARMA_IdListMembers_V01.xml file.

revisionDesc.change: Updating toward the encoding template v03

div.head: Plates
div.p:
śrīmatāṁ sakala-bhuvana-saṁstūyamāna-mānavya-sagotraāṇāṁ hārītī
-putrāṇāṁ loka-mātrir̥bhir mātrir̥bhir abhivarddhitānāṁ bhagavaT-śc-chrī
-nārāyaṇa-prasāda-samupalabdha-vara-varāha-lāñchanānāṁ
svāmi-mahāsena-pādānudhyātānāṁ Anekāśvamedha-yāji
nāṁ caḷukyānāṁ kulam alaṁkariṣṇoḥ śrī-viṣṇuvarddhana-mahārājaCHECK:Hultzsch says perhaps the ma of mahārāja seems to be corrected from mā, but I can’t even read his note properly, much less the estampage
sya prapautraḥ CHECK Hultzsch says something about this abhyuccita being a Pallava style.Abhyuccita-śakti-siddhi-saṁpannasya pratāpopanata-rāja
-maṇḍalasya paCHECK I think correction from sa to pa.ra-nr̥pati-matta-mātaṁga-kumbha-sthala-vidāraṇa-vidhi-darśita
siṁha-vikramasya siṁhavikramasya raṇa-bhūṣaṇāyamāna
vraṇa-kiṇālaṁkr̥ta-sarvva-gātrasya Aneka-go-hiraṇya-bhūmy-ādi-pra
dānaiḥ pravr̥ddha-dharmma-sañcayasya śrīmato mahārājasyendra-bhaṭṭā
raka-varmmaṇaḥ pautraḥ sva-bāhu-balārjitorjjita-kṣātra-tapo-nidheḥ vidhi-vi
hita-sarvva-maryyādasya pratāpāCORR FROM POnurāgāvanata-sāmanta-cakrasya
cakravartti-lakṣaṇopetasya gr̥hītāneka-tuṁgāri-vasudhā
-makara-dhvajasya makaradhvajasya sva-prabhāvārjjita-sakala-sāmanta
makuṭa-taṭa-ghaṭita-maṇi-kiraṇāruṇīkr̥ta-caraṇāravindasya
śrī-viṣṇuvarddhana-mahārājasya putraḥ nija-bhuja-parākramāvanamitāneka
śatru-sāmantānīta-dvirada-pati-mada-dhārābhiṣeka-karddamita-sapta
chcchada-surabhiCHECK Hultzsch says compare Śiśupālavadha 6.50; there was also a similar phrase in another EC grant that I may have translated differently.-ramyāgaṇopaviṣṭāneka-rājanyāmita-samiti-ko
laāhalībhūta-rājadvāra[+ḥ] madālasa-mattakāśinī-jana-ghana-payo
dharāvalupyamāna-kuṁkuma-paṁkāvaśeṣa-śobhita-kanaka-giri-śi
lā-viśāla-vakṣa-sthalaḥ Aneka-samara-sāhasāvamardda-labdha-vija
ya-siddhiḥ jaladhir iva ramyatara-lakṣmī-laḷlita-nivāsaḥ mūrtta Iva va
santaḥ samudga Iva guṇāṇāṁ dr̥ṣṭānta Iva bhūmipatīnāṁ
parama-brahmaṇyaḥ mahārājānubhāva-śrī-sarvvalokāśraya-mahārājaḥ
kamma-rāṣṭre cendaṟura-grāme grāmeyakān atra-gata-sarvva-naiyogika
-vallabhāṁś cājñāpayati[+.]

Eṣa grāmo [+’]smābhiḥ brāhmaṇebhyaḥ chandogebhyaḥHULTZSCH note: this visarga is not visible in the published estampage, but it is clear in the inked impressions.
kauṇḍinya-gotrebhyaḥ ṣaṭ-karmma-niratebhyaḥ satatāvicchinna-pa CHECK I think correction from sa to pa.ñca-mahāyajña
-kriyebhyaḥ

kaṭūra-vāstavyāya dve Aṁśe[+.] vaṁgra-boyāya dve[+.] koḷḷipu
ṟo-boyāya dve[+.] pidena-boyāya dve[+.] kuriyi-boyāya dve[+.] kāḷa
bava-bgotrāya kodiṁka-boyāya dve Aṁśe[+.]

Evam etebhyaḥ brahCHECK, h seems to be corrected from b.ma-deya
-maryyādayā sarvva-parihāropeto devabhoga-hala-varjjaṁ Āyur-bala-vija
yābhivr̥ddhaye sa[+ṁ]prattaḥ[+.] tad avagamya pariharantu parihārayantu ca[+.]
yo [+’]smaT-śc-chāsanam atikraāCHECK is Hultzsch right to correct?meT sa pāpaḥ śārīran daṇḍam arhati[+.]

Api cātrājñaptir udaya-giri-śikhara-makuṭāyamāna-bhāskara Iva nara
bhāskaraḥ Ayyaṇānvaya-dharaṇi-maṇḍala-kula-parvvataḥ Aneka-samara
-saṁghaṭṭa-vijayī parama-māheśvaraḥ śrīmad aṇaCHECK Hultzsch: ṇa seems to be corrected from da, emend na. I wonder if amogha was meant instead.ghavarmmā[+.] Api cātra brahma
gītāau ślokeau bhavataḥ[+.]

pravarddhamāna-vijaya-rājya-saṁvatsare dvi
tīya vaiśākha-paurṇṇamaāsyāṁ grahaṇa-nimittaṁ dattā paṭṭikā[+.] svasty a
stu sarvva-bhūtebhyaḥ[+.] pāṁbeyena sarvvottamenādhtharvvaṇena likhitaM||spiralR||

Reported in 7A/1905-19062 with some further details at 61-6241. Edited from estampages by E. Hultzsch(), with estampages, without translation, with a postscript by Kielhorn on the date. The present edition by Dániel Balogh is based on a collation of Hultzsch's edition with his facsimiles.
